title: For Sale:  VZ-58/VZ2008 7.62x39 w/ 5 mags and more
postcontent:
For Sale: CAI built VZ2008 (VZ58 Clone) Rifle in 7.62x39mm.

This is a striker fired rifle and only resembles an AK in looks, but shoots like an SKS.  She was designed by the Czechs to be the ultimate F U to the Russians, as it has proprietary mags and non soviet compatible parts.  She has tighter tolerances than an AK, leading to better accuracy, and the milled receiver makes it 1 lbs lighter than an AK even loaded.    It comes with 5 surplus 30 rd mags, bayonet and scabbard, cleaning kit (minus the rod), extra foreguard with minor crack, surplus sling, leather surplus magazine pouch, a M-16 style "Phantom" Muzzle break installed, and the original factory AK style slanted muzzle break.

I have owned this rifle almost 3 months and have only put about 10 rounds through it of non corrosive.  It is in almost brand new condition.  She does have one quirk related to the magazines; they are in "surplus" condition, but have the tightest springs I've ever encountered.  This leads to the occasional feed issue when the mags are loaded to 30rd capacity.  The bolt just can't strip the round off the top of the mag due to the high tension.  Through exhaustive research, I have found that this can be remedied by putting her through her break in paces, or trimming the mag spring.

I no longer have the time or enthusiasm for this gun due to recent love affair with AR builds.
I am not really interested in trades, but may consider partial trade of a nice AR optic.

For an additional $100 I can throw in 2 Red Army Stardard range packs (total of 351rds)-Nice non-corrosive 123gr. FMJ with lacquer coated primers and steel case.

Shoot me an email or call/text REDACTED.  Thanks!

title: For Sale:  WarSport LVOA AR-15 5.56/223 Rifle  Item 2943
location: Rocky Mount, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
War Sport LVOA-C (16″ Carbine) spec’s
•14.5″ Mid-gas Ultra Match Grade DI barrel, 1:8 (Pinned & Welded muzzle brake)
•Chamber options: NATO 5.56mm (default)
•LVOA Rail: 16.2″ with Anti-Rotation support
•Trigger: “Single Stage” 3.5-lb Flat Trigger
•Forged Lower: 7075 T6, MilSpec
•45-deg Ambi “Fire/Safe” control (90-deg option also available)
•KNS Anti Rotation Trigger/Hammer pin kit
•Ambi Charging Handle
•Ambi Magazine Release
•LVOA Rail Bungee installed
•Color: Foliage Green

The LVOA AR ships with Rail Bungee (Shock Cord) installed on the rail. The “Bungee” provides better grip under wet conditions, reduces the noise and harmonics the rail may produce, gives the shooter a quick -n- easy way to secure cables from lights, lasers, etc… The bungee can also be utilized to “suspended” the muzzle end of the weapon when conditions permit (Vehicle applications, HELO applications, wounded Shooter, etc…)

The LVOA design principle was to engineer an SBR platform (Entry Weapon, CQC, CQB, etc…) that offers the lowest Flash Signature without the use of a sound suppressor (Go Loud, Go Fast without the Flash). The final outcome of our testing also produced one of the flattest shooting AR’s on the market with almost zero felt impulse. Target acquisition and follow up shots with the LVOA AR is very fast even for the novice shooter. The LVOA -S (SBR) is a very accurate system from 0 – 300yds with plenty of knock down energy.  We accomplished these benefits by using a full muzzle brake and designing a rail system that encompasses the muzzle brake and acts as a “Flash Hider” and temperature regulator, so basically you get a the best of both worlds (Flash Hider + Muzzle Brake).

We have tested most ammo spending much of the testing on “cheaper” ammo to achieve the best results. We found that quality ammo from 69gr and up perform the best. We also tested from Sea level and to upper altitudes. Sea Level combined with cheaper ammo (Inconsistent Powder) provides the worst results even though still out performs any SBR in regards to flashing.

The LVOA AR design was developed by the needs of the “CQC Shooter” who learned the hard way what doesn’t work and what does in combat. We (War Sport) did not set out to develop gadgets and devices which add weight and complexity to the AR/M4 platform. Instead we reduced material to add some basic old school functionality and features

title: For Sale:  .22 ammo
postcontent: Last Thursday I called the Field and Stream store in Cranberry township to see if they had any.22 ammo (which they frequently have).  I was told on the phone that they had a pallet out of Remington Gold and Winchester.  I went there on Friday and it was all gone.  One of the workers told me people come in and out five and ten times while they are at the store and buy the limit of three boxes each time at about $30 per box.  These are the assholes that buy and hoard it and offer it for sale for $50 a box on this site and other sites.  The worker told me one guy bragged that he had 30,000 rounds of .22.  I and many others buy this .22 ammo to take their kids and grandkids shooting when they're too little to shoot much else.  And I try to believe there are not a lot of just plain greedy obnoxious self centered assholes in the firearm and shooting community.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger MKIII Hunter Stainless Target Pistol
postcontent:
I have a Ruger MkIII Hunter for sale or trade.
If you are looking at this you know what they are. 
These are amazing .22 pistols! 
Some of the most accurate .22's out there.

This is like new with box and everything that goes with it!

These run $620 plus tax & paperwork at cabella's (~$680 total)


Here is a little rundown on it...

Simple, rugged, and affordable, the Ruger Mark III Hunter Rimfire Pistol continues the legacy created by the Ruger Standard, Mark I and Mark II pistols with modern engineering refinements. The Hunter's internal cylindrical bolt construction design delivers higher accuracy potential than conventional moving slide designs by ensuring permanent alignment. Durable stainless steel frame and 6.88'' fluted bull barrel. Pistol comes with a light-gathering HiViz® fiber optic front sight and precision adjustable rear sight for sure accuracy.  Receiver comes drilled and tapped for Weaver®-style scope base adapters (included) for easy mounting of optics. The smoothly contoured grip sports a natural pointing grip angle with checkered Cocobolo grip panels. Loaded chamber indicator provides visual and tactile indication when a round is in the chamber. Manual safety, magazine disconnect, and inconspicuous internal lock.

title: For Sale:  GORMARK LLC GORMARKLLC BUSINESS NAME BEING USED IN SCAM SCAMMERS BEWARE
postcontent:
I am the owner of Gormark LLC, a business and licensed firearms dealer. For a year now some scammers have been using my business name and are claiming to be me. They offer for sale fine guns - usually Colt's revolvers or 1911 style pistols - on this site at very attractive prices. They correspond by email, as probably do you, but they may provide a phone number to call, and of course a name and address to send payment.

IT'S A SCAM!

I am a non-stocking dealer that does this part time. I do not currently have any handguns advertised on this site, nor am I working as the transfer dealer for any of my customers. The scammers have a copy of my FFL license, which is now an old version, but looks current - it's a forgery! ATF and USPS know this and have an open investigation.

If you are suspicious of a listing copy some of the text in the ad and search the Internet for it. You will often find the original auction ad, from which these scammers stole. Click also on "other listings by user" here and you will see what other items they have for sale. Search the Internet for these. These scammers are good. The person accepting payment is probably not directly involved; they just cash money orders and forward most of that on, keeping some for themselves. Real innocent, right?

title: For Sale:  Barrett MRAD Grey, Tan, or ODG .308 22" Fluted Barrel
postcontent:
Brand New! Factory Fresh! New in box!

Ready to follow your every move, the MRAD adapts to a variety of user needs without sacrificing performance. With unfailing accuracy, this bolt-action system continues to define a whole new class of long-range precision rifles.

The MRAD rifle's user-changeable barrel system is just one example of this hardworking gun's modularity. Available in .338 Lapua Magnum, .300 Winchester Magnum and .308 Winchester, the precision grade barrel can be removed by simply loosening two bolts using a standard Torx wrench. Besides reducing maintenance and logistical burdens, this unique design allows for user level caliber interchangeability and serviceability with the MRAD rifle's barrel kits.

The MRAD also boasts Barrett's fully adjustable match-grade trigger module, which is user accessible. The thumb-operated safety can be configured for left or right hand operation. The ambidextrous magazine release can be used intuitively while retaining a firing grip and cheek weld.

Integrated into the MRAD rifle's 7000 series aluminum upper receiver is a 21.75 inch M1913 rail with 30 MOA taper. The forward receiver is drilled and tapped for accessory rails to be mounted at the 3, 6 and 9 o'clock positions.

The MRAD stock is foldable for enhanced portability yet locks in as solid as a fixed-stock rifle, creating a rigid platform for consistent firing. During transport the stock folds and locks onto the bolt handle maintaining the same rifle width whether folded or extended.

Made of a temperature-resistant polymer, the adjustable cheek piece also offers a consistent rifle-to-user contact point. The rifle's length of pull can be set to five different positions with the push of a single button.

From its quick-detach sling mounts to the Barrett Multi-Role Brown color that blends into any environment - every detail of the MRAD has been carefully designed to create one thing: a high-performance rifle you can truly make your own.

Caliber:.308 Winchester

The AF2011-A1 obviously features a number of very special parts, such as the single slide, the single frame, the single spur double hammer, the single grip safety, the single body double mainspring housing and the single double cavity magazine floor plate, the long and double magazine latch, the special barrel bushings and the hold open lever and side lever safety with long shafts: but the most interesting feature of the new pistol which we strived to keep during the development of the project, is the interchangeability of most internal parts, which come as standard 1911 replacement parts. These include the firing pins, the firing pins plates, the sears groups, the triple springs, the inner parts of the mainspring housings, the recoil springs and recoil springs rods, the magazine bodies and inner parts, the sights (including after market adjustable sights) the grips and grips screws and bushings.

title: For Sale/Trade:  The beast of Stalingrad PU sniper
postcontent:
This is a very nice Russian PU sniper that was purchased a while back from Simpsons LTD. It is a 1942 rifle with a 1943 PU 3.5 power sniper scope. The scope mount has been arsenal matched and machined to the rifle, so there is no give on the mount. No shimming necessary and it's rock solid. It is currently sighted in at 100 yards using Bulgarian silver tip surplus ammo. This is a very excellent example of WWII technology and sniper set ups from the communist bloc. Think Vasily Zaytsev....or the movie featuring his exploits "enemy at the Gates". This particular rifles has probably killed Nazi's and it has for sure killed coyotes and deer. 

**I'M NOT INTERESTED IN SHIPPING**

Sorry. This rifle is for TRADE only. I'm not interested in selling it outright, however if your trade isn't up to value I will accept cash difference. Conversely, I also don't mind adding cash or ammo if your offer is over value.

title: For Sale:  Walther P38 - P1 9m/m Luger Cal. Semi-Auto Pistol
location: South East Virginnia, Virginia, United States
postcontent:
NOTE: it is the buyers responsibility to confirm that this firearm is legal to own in your state and/or locality.

Offered for your consideration is one (1) Walther P38 – P1 semi-automatic pistol chambered in the very popular 9m/m, (9X19m/m – Luger), caliber. This P1 is in excellent condition showing only very minor finish wear on a few sharp edges. It comes with a period German camouflaged holster, cleaning kit, original Walther P1 magazine, and owners manual. It was manufactured in April, 1974.

In late 1963 the postwar military model P1 was adopted for use by the German military, identifiable by the P1 stamping on the slide. The postwar pistols, whether marked as P38 or P1, have an aluminum frame rather than the steel frame of the original design. The aluminum frame was later reinforced with a hex bolt above the trigger guard. During the 1990s the German military started replacing the P1 with the P8 pistol and finally phased out the P1 in 2004.

Additional pictures upon request.

Modern, Curio / Relic, Antique Firearms: YOU HAVE A 3 DAY INSPECTION PERIOD BEGINNING AT THE TIME THAT YOUR MERCHANDISE ARRIVES EITHER AT YOUR MAILING ADDRESS, OR IN THE CASE OF A MODERN OR CURIO / RELIC FIREARM, AT YOUR FFL DEALER'S MAILING ADDRESS. During this period the firearm is not to be fired or disassembled in any fashion. If you choose to return the item, it MUST be received by Foxfire Rod & Gun in the EXACT and SAME condition as you received it. Tooele Shooting Supply just received a shipment of BRAND NEW FIREARMS, including a couple brand new, factory fresh are very hard to find Henry Golden Boy Silver Eagle .22 LR rifles! These are beautiful lever-actions, featuring a nickel engraved receiver, American Walnut buttstock, and 20″ octagon barrel.

Henry H004SE Silver Eagle .22S/L/LR Lever-Action Rifle w/ 20″ Octagon Barrel, Nickel Receiver, Walnut Buttstock

The Henry Silver Eagle is based on the engraved scroll and silver plated Serial Number 9 Henry Rifle presented to US Secretary of the Navy Gideon Welles by The New Haven Arms Company. Welles served under President Lincoln, distinguished himself as a political leader nationally, and was one of the organizers of the Republican Party. Secretary Welles was also instrumental in the creation of the Navy’s Medal of Honor.

Using original photos and hand drawings of the Gideon Welles Serial Number 9 as reference, the master plate used in the creation of the new Silver Eagle pattern was hand cut for production with full coverage on both sides of the receiver cover.


The Silver Eagle pattern, like the Henry Rifle itself, is one piece of American history without rival. This model is built on the award winning Henry Golden Boy platform. The rifle features a traditional 20″ octagonal barrel outfitted with buckhorn sights; a gunsmithing masterpiece that closely mirrors its legendary predecessors, the original Henrys when they were patented in 1860.

title: For Sale:  M1916 Spanish Mauser (.308)
postcontent: I have had this gun for about 30 years and it is in pretty good shape!  When I got the gun the stock was missing and I had a hard time back In the 90's locating one.  I finally found a German Mauser stock and it worked.  The barrel needs banded to the stock and it will more than likely need a new barrel. This would be a great gun to turn into a .243 or something similar.
